thread.title: Man City target Virgil van Dijk will not leave Southampton without a fight
thread.title_full: Man City target Virgil van Dijk will not leave Southampton without a fight

author: Stuart Brennan
title: Man City target Virgil van Dijk will not leave Southampton without a fight
text:
Sport Man City target Virgil van Dijk will not leave Southampton without a fight Saints chairman says Holland defender is 'very committed' to the club and they have no intention of selling their best players this summer Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get Manchester City FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Southampton have warned Manchester City and other interested clubs that they won't give up Virgil van Dijk without a fight in the summer. 
The Blues have been tracking the progress of the £40million-rated Holland international as Pep Guardiola seek to beef up their centre-back options for next season. 
There were even reports that City checked out his availability in the January window, leading to Southampton players pranking van Dijk by handing him a Blues shirt. 
City could also go back in for Athletic Bilbao's young French star Aymeric Laporte and are keeping an eye on Atletico Madrid's Lucas Hernandez. 
But Southampton chairman Ralph Krueger has warned any clubs who are chasing the 25-year-old that they will not give him up without a fight. 
“Virgil is committed to us for a long time and we don’t see anything but that in our future,” said Krueger. 
“We will be sitting together in a few weeks to look at our summer transfer window and what the plans are. Read More
